alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Fayette; Franklin; Union (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA, SOUTHERN UNION COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA AND SOUTHERN FAYETTE COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Lake Santee, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Bright, West College Corner, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Blooming Grove, Columbia, Metamora, St. Leon, Laurel, Scipio, College Corner, West Harrison, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Mounds State Recreation Area, Hamburg, Interstate 74 at US Route 52 and Rockdale. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana near mile marker 148, and between mile markers 158 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
